title: Analysis of Pre-Training Effects and Video-Directed Learning Strategies in Large-Scale Computer-Based Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of fundamental social science theories and experience using computer-based learning tools
context.additional_context: Learners asynchronously access content using personal devices and apply knowledge through project-based assessment. Focuses on systematically understanding complex concepts in social sciences.

learning_goals: Learners can explain complex concepts in social sciences with over 80% accuracy through video-based direct instruction.
Learners can write an experimental report comparing learning efficiency by measuring changes in cognitive load based on prior training.
Learners can complete a project analyzing the effects of learning motivation and topic interest on cognitive load and academic performance.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
